page.title: 19FARMING IN THE GROVE AREA
page.content: The Tudor Hercy family started the area's farming tradition in depth. Sheep were important for the Nottingham Wool Trade.Today only one field of 50 or so sheep was found in the whole area.There are more cattle than sheep but,particularly around the village of Grove,field upon field is given over to the growing of wheat and barley.Many of the fields are now larger,with the original sub-division hedges missing.Large spraying machines,on their high wheels,were much in evidence early in the summer. Used for both pesticides and fertilisers,they must account for the tremendous increase in yield per acre over recent years.Well over 100% we were informed! On two local farms goats were kept and their milk was available for sale.Pigeons were also kept by one local household.
